snippet: A new report documents the nearly 10,000 civilian deaths across Iraq so far in 2014, including horrific crimes by Islamic State militants, especially against religious minorities and women.
abstract: United Nations reports more than 5,500 people have been killed in Iraq since offensive by Islamic State militant group began in June, including hundreds of minority Yazidis slaughtered en masse.
lead_paragraph: A new report documents the nearly 10,000 civilian deaths across Iraq so far in 2014, including horrific crimes by Islamic State militants, especially against religious minorities and women.

headline.main: 5,500 Iraqis Killed Since Islamic State Began Its Military Drive, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: 5,500 Iraqis Killed Since Islamic State Began Its Military Drive, U.N. Says

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
